Offers utility methods related to reflection.

Method Detail

instantiate

public static <T> T instantiate(String beanClassName,
                                Class<T> type)
                     throws UtilityException
Finds a class by name and instantiates it.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the new bean
Parameters:
beanClassName - the name of the class to instantiate
type - the type of the bean class (can be a supertype of the actual bean class)
Returns:
a new instance of the class with the given name, cast to the given type
Throws:
UtilityException - when no class with the given name can be found, when the bean class is not assignable to the specified type, or when the bean class can't be initialised

instantiate

public static <T> T instantiate(Class<T> beanClass)
                     throws UtilityException
Instantiates a class.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the new object
Parameters:
beanClass - the class to instantiate
Returns:
a new instance of the given class
Throws:
UtilityException - when the class can't be instantiated

getPackageName

public static String getPackageName(Class<?> type)
Returns the name of a package in which a type resides.

Parameters:
type - the type to determine the package name of
Returns:
the name of type's package, the empty string if type is in the default package

wrapPrimitiveType

public static Class<?> wrapPrimitiveType(Class<?> type)
Determines the wrapper type for a primitive type.

Parameters:
type - the type to wrap
Returns:
the wrapped type for primitives (e.g. Boolean.class for Boolean.TYPE), the type itself for non-primitive types

isAbstract

public static boolean isAbstract(Class<?> type)
Determines whether a type is abstract or not.

Parameters:
type - the type of which needs to be found out whether it's abstract or not
Returns:
true if type is abstract, false otherwise

isGetter

public static boolean isGetter(Method method)
                        throws UtilityException
Determines whether a method is a getter, in the JavaBeans sense of the word.

Parameters:
method - the method to examine
Returns:
true if the method is a getter, false otherwise
Throws:
UtilityException - if no information about the method's declaring class can be found

getProperty

public static <T> T getProperty(Object bean,
                                Class<T> propertyType,
                                String propertyName)
                     throws UtilityException
Reads a property value from a bean.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the property
Parameters:
bean - the bean to get the property value from
propertyType - the expected type of the property
propertyName - the name of the property
Returns:
the value of the property on the given bean
Throws:
UtilityException - when the property is of a different type than was expected, when the property is write-only, or when something goes wrong while getting the value

isSetter

public static boolean isSetter(Method method)
                        throws UtilityException
Determines whether a method is a setter, in the JavaBeans sense of the word.

Parameters:
method - the method to examine
Returns:
true if the method is a setter, false otherwise
Throws:
UtilityException - if no information about the method's declaring class can be found

setProperty

public static <T> void setProperty(Object bean,
                                   Class<T> propertyType,
                                   String propertyName,
                                   T propertyValue)
                        throws UtilityException
Sets a property value on a bean.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the property
Parameters:
bean - the bean to set the property value on
propertyType - the expected type of the property
propertyName - the name of the property
propertyValue - the value to set
Throws:
UtilityException - when the property is of a different type than was expected, when the property is read-only, or when something goes wrong while setting the value

getPropertyName

public static String getPropertyName(Method method)
                              throws UtilityException
Determines the name of a property based on its getter or setter.

Parameters:
method - the getter or setter of a property
Returns:
the name of the property that the given method is a getter or setter for
Throws:
UtilityException - when the method is neither a getter nor a setter
